type.name: section
type.title: Short title.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Short title. 1. This Act may be cited as the Guyana Export Promotion Council Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Guyana Export Promotion Council Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Interpretation. 2. In this Act  Council means the Guyana Export Promotion Council established by section
type.description: In this Act  Council means the Guyana Export Promotion Council established by section

type.name: section
type.title: Establishment and incorporation of Council.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Establishment and incorporation of Council. 3.

type.name: section
type.title: Functions of Council.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Functions of Council. 4. (1) It shall be the function of the Council  (a) from time to time, to make recommendations and tender advice to the Minister on the formulation of national export policies and on the implementation of such policies;  (b) from time to time, to make LAWS OF GUYANA Guyana Export Promotion Council Cap. 91:11 5  L.R.O. 1/2012                              Employment of staff of Council.              Secondment or transfer of officers to recommendations and tender   advice   to   the   Minister   on practical   measures  to stimulate the export trade of the country; and  (c)   to   promote   and   enhance   the   orderly development of the export trade of the country.  (2) Subject to the provisions of this Act and to any directions given   by the   Minister,   the   Council   shall,   for   the purpose  of  the discharge of its functions under subsection (1), have power to do all such things and  engage in all such activities as are in its opinion necessary for, or conducive to the proper discharge of its functions, including (without  prejudice  to  the  generality  of the foregoing) research, training consultancy and advisory activities  and  the compilation and issue of journals, bulletins and other publications.  (3) The Minister may in writing exclude specified products from the purview of the Council.

type.name: section
type.title: Employment of staff of Council.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Employment of staff of Council. 5.  (1) The Council, with the approval of the Minister, may employ at such remuneration and on such other terms and conditions as it thinks fit (including the payment of pensions, gratuities and other like benefits by reference to the service of its officers and other employees) a Chief Executive Officer and such other officers and employees as the Council may require to carry out its functions effectively.  (2) The Council may, at any time, retain the services of experts and other professional persons and may pay such remuneration in respect thereof as the Council, with the approval of the Minister, may determine.

type.name: section
type.title: Remuneration of members.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Remuneration of members. 7. There shall be paid to the members of the Council such remuneration, whether by way of salaries or travelling or other allowances, as the Minister may determine.
type.description: There shall be paid to the members of the Council such remuneration, whether by way of salaries or travelling or other allowances, as the Minister may determine.

type.name: section
type.title: Disclosure of interest.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Disclosure of interest. 8. It shall be the duty of a member who is in any way,  whether  directly  or  indirectly,  interested  in  any  contract  or  any other arrangement with the Council to declare the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Council and he shall not take part in any discussion of, or vote on any question relating to, the contract or other arrangement.

type.name: section
type.title: Protection of persons acting under this Act.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Protection of persons acting under this Act. 9.  Any person acting under this Act shall be entitled to the protection afforded by the Justices Protection Act.
type.description: Any person acting under this Act shall be entitled to the protection afforded by the Justices Protection Act.

type.title: Funds and resources of Council.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Funds and resources of Council. 10.  (1) The funds and resources of the Council shall consist of  (a) such sums as may be provided by Parliament; LAWS OF GUYANA Guyana Export Promotion Council Cap. 91:11 7  L.R.O. 1/2012                              Charging of fees for service rendered.   Borrowing powers of Council.      Guarantee by Minister of Finance of borrowing by Council and repayment of sums paid to (b) revenue obtained by virtue of the provisions of section 11;  (c) such moneys or other assets as may accrue to, or vest in,  the  Council  by  way  of  grants, subsidies,  bequests, donations or gifts;  (d) sums  borrowed  by  the  Council  for  the purpose of meeting any of its obligations or discharging any of its functions;  (e) all other sums or property that may in any manner become payable to or vested in the Council in respect of any matter incidental to its powers and duties.  (2) The expenses of the Council including any remuneration of its members, officers and employees shall be paid out of the funds and resources of the Council.

type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Borrowing powers of Council. 12. The Council may, with the  approval of the Minister responsible  for  finance,  borrow  any  money  required  by  it  for meeting any of its obligations or discharging any of its functions.
type.description: The Council may, with the  approval of the Minister responsible  for  finance,  borrow  any  money  required  by  it  for meeting any of its obligations or discharging any of its functions.

type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Guarantee by Minister of Finance of borrowing by Council and  repayment of sums paid to meet guarantees. 13. (1) With the approval of the National Assembly, the Minister responsible for finance may guarantee, in such manner and on such conditions as he may think fit, the payment of the principal and interest on any authorized borrowing of the Council. (2) Where the Minister responsible for finance is satisfied that there  has  been  default  in  the  repayment  of  any  principal moneys or interest guaranteed under this section, he shall direct the repayment out of the general assets and revenues of the amount in respect of which there has been such default.  (3) The Council shall make to the Accountant General, at such  time  and  in  such  manner  as  the  Minister  responsible  for finance may direct, payments of such amounts as may be so directed in or towards repayment of any such sum issued in fulfilment of any guarantee given under this section, and payment of interest on what is outstanding for the time being in respect of any sums so issued at such rate as the Minister responsible for finance   may direct, and different rates of interest may be directed as respects  different sums and as respects interest for different periods.

type.name: section
type.title: Report.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Report. 15.  (1) The Council shall not later than six months after the end   of   each   financial   year   submit   a   report   to   the   Minister containing  (a) an  account  of its  transactions  throughout the  preceding financial year in such details as the Minister may direct: and  (b) a statement  of the  accounts of the  Council audited  in accordance with section 14 (2).  (2) A copy of the report together with a copy of the auditors report shall be printed and laid before the National Assembly.

type.name: section
type.title: Power of Minister to give directions to Council
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Power of Minister to give directions to Council 16.  The Minister may give to the Council written directions of a general or special character as to the policy to be followed by the Council in the discharge of its functions and the Council shall give effect to those directions.
type.description: The Minister may give to the Council written directions of a general or special character as to the policy to be followed by the Council in the discharge of its functions and the Council shall give effect to those directions.

type.name: section
type.title: Exemption from taxes and duties.
type.context: GUYANA EXPORT PROMOTION COUNCIL    ACT under Exemption from taxes and duties. 17.  The Council shall be exempt from the payment  of customs duty, capital gains tax, Corporation tax, income tax, property tax and purchase tax.
type.description: The Council shall be exempt from the payment  of customs duty, capital gains tax, Corporation tax, income tax, property tax and purchase tax.
